author: Mollie Russell
description:
When Dungeons and Dragons announced it was returning to the Forgotten Realms setting with two new books, I was elated. Lovers of lore have been starved for content for years, and the thought of a fresh deep dive into D&D’s most famous locale was enticing. However, now that more details have been revealed, Wizards of the Coast has me worried.

Continue reading DnD's going all in on fanservice, and I'm nervous for the Forgotten Realms books
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: DnD's going all in on fanservice, and I'm nervous for the Forgotten Realms books

author: Callum Self
description:
Lego is best when it allows you to recreate something beloved and completely mess it up to be unique. The Star Wars franchise is full of possibilities to do something a little different, and this Lego Star Wars TIE Fighter and X-Wing mashup proves it, delivering two of the series’ most iconic ships and making it trivial to switch their parts. Ardent Lego collectors will tell you that the best time to collect Lego sets is when they’re on sale, and right now there’s a short window of time to get this set at a hefty discount.

Continue reading Get this weird mashup of iconic Lego Star Wars ships at a healthy discount
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Biggest LEGO sets, LEGO sets for adults, Best Star Wars LEG
title: Get this weird mashup of iconic Lego Star Wars ships at a healthy discount

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Soul Stone MTG card was revealed last week. That, alongside hints that the rest of Thanos' Infinity stones would be appearing in Magic: The Gathering in the future, and head designer Mark Rosewater’s declaration that Spider-man was “the beginning, but far, far from the end,” of Wizards of the Coast’s Marvel partnership, leaves one obvious conclusion…

Continue reading The thought of six Magic: The Gathering Marvel sets fills me with dread
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: The thought of six Magic: The Gathering Marvel sets fills me with dread

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Games Workshop has released the all-important Legacies of the Age of Darkness PDF for Warhammer: the Horus Heresy. This free document contains rules for scores of units that have been playable in previous editions of the game but which are missing from third edition's army books, letting established players continue to use models that - for a while at least - seemed like they were no longer game legal.

Continue reading GW just dropped 200+ pages of free Warhammer the Horus Heresy unit rules
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Horus Heresy book order, Warhammer 40k factions, Warhammer 40k primarchs
title: GW just dropped 200+ pages of free Warhammer the Horus Heresy unit rules

author: Mollie Russell
description:
In converting the mammoth board game Frosthaven into a PC dungeon crawler, Snapshot Games didn’t make any sweeping changes. This is still a co-op puzzle of turn-based exploration and combat, with some story and base-building sprinkled in. It’s still the Frosthaven I’ve spent months with at the tabletop. So, why, after completing the initial tutorial and mission, does digital Frosthaven feel so much harsher than the original?

Continue reading Frosthaven digital is slicker than the board game, but far less forgiving
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games for adults, Best two-player board games, Upcoming board game Kickstarters
title: Frosthaven digital is slicker than the board game, but far less forgiving

author: Matt Bassil
description:
There’s a new Pokémon Pocket deck racking up tournament wins, but the community doesn’t seem to have caught on yet. This Eeveelutions deck centered around the new Espeon ex card from Wisdom of Sea and Sky is winning contests, yet so far very few people are playing it.

Continue reading This Espeon ex Pokémon Pocket deck is criminally underrated
MORE FROM WARGAMER: How many Pokémon are there?, How to play Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards
title: This Espeon ex Pokémon Pocket deck is criminally underrated
